website_summaries.verdict: With its sensor-based averaging features, this ecobee offers efficient heating and cooling, works well with newer heat pumps, and integrates with connected home systems easily.
pros: Installation is relatively simple using existing thermostat wiring
Sensor-based “follow me” feature optimizes heating and cooling well
Multiple comfort settings allow for plenty of customization
Good integration with Alexa as well as Apple’s HomeKit
cons: Thermostat itself can run “warm” or overheat, requiring extra component or electrician to fix
Not all control features, like HomeIQ, are included in the mobile app
Some users have trouble with installation

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you have a two story home.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a two story house and have always been frustrated that the second floor was always hot at night. The thermostat is on the main floor so it fails to turn on the air conditioning. Having a thermostat that has multiple sensors has made all of the difference. Switching sensors from main floor to upstairs a half an hour before bedtime is wonderful. The whole family has commented on how much more comfortable the house is. Have recommended it to neighbors and friends who have a two story home. Will purchase again if I move to another multi story home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No matter what I do it can't read correct temperature
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for one year, bought from Amazon. The temperature setting is off by 6 degrees. You can program adjust for this in settings but the next day temperature setting off 8 degrees. Even bought from Amazon a counter top temperature gauge to compare. Reboot setting to factory many times and same result. Been dealing with this for one year, no matter what I do it can't read correct temperature. My electric bills have been going up because of this. Don't waste your money. Who's writing these good reviews? Hardly ever write reviews but this one deserves One Star.
customer_reviews.author: Gator

customer_reviews.title: Bested the Nest
customer_reviews.text: We have a long house, and the thermostat is on the opposite side from where the bedroom was. At the time of purchase, the Ecobee was the only decent thermostat that offered remote sensors, so that (regardless of impact on efficiency) we could set it up to react to bedroom temps at night, and living room temps during the day. Doesn't hurt that it looks sharp, and I appreciate the exportable reports & community comparisons they provide via the web interface.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dunphy

customer_reviews.title: The remote sensors sold me.
customer_reviews.text: I spent a long time comparing both the Ecobee3 and the Nest thermostats. What finally sold me on the Ecobee was the remote sensor feature. It only makes sense that a thermostat not only know the temperature of its installed location but also of the entire house. I plan to buy more sensors because I placed my single sensor upstairs. The Ecobee does an amazing job of making our home comfortable. And now that the price has been reduced, it made me pull the trigger. Installation was easy and everything worked out of the box. Thank you Ecobee!
customer_reviews.author: JRA

customer_reviews.title: Nice interface
customer_reviews.text: Its sooo nice to be laying in bed at night and think, I want to turn the AC/heat up, and be able to do it from your phone! We use the password protection feature as we host guests and don't like anyone messing with our settings (without asking). The second sensor is great for our old home where the basement/main floor/upstairs can be almost 10 degrees off. It will average the two temperatures, so the upstairs will be a bit hot, the basement a bit cold, but better than one comfortable and the other crazy warm!
customer_reviews.author: Ollie G

customer_reviews.title: Faulty display on multiple units but functions well
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the product works and so far it has worked well. The reason it gets 3 stars is that I have had to replace it twice due to faulty display out of the box on both units. They have vertical and horizontal lines across the display making it difficult to read but does not seem to impact it's function otherwise. I found it reasonably easy to install and when I did call customer service to assist with a setting they were friendly and knowledgeable. I called them on a Saturday and the hold times were a little long (+20min) but was resolved quickly after I did get them on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: HomeKit drops it constantly
customer_reviews.text: I love having this in my house. But if you plan on using it with HomeKit plan on pulling out your hair. I have three in my house and they are constantly disconnecting from HomeKit, and I can't control them with my iPhone unless i use the Ecobee app which is so annoying. I have to unplug it by pulling the thermostat off the wall then plug it back. Then it shows up on HomeKit again. And I have to do this about ever 2 weeks.. Sometimes it shows up sometimes it doesn't its hit or miss.
customer_reviews.author: James from AZ

customer_reviews.title: Bought this while making the house smart. Installed per directions
customer_reviews.text: Bought this while making the house smart. Installed per directions. Heating/ac would not work. Circulation fan would come on but burners would not light. Called tech support numerous times; sent pictures of wiring, pictures of installation, after two weeks I was told I needed to rewire the furnace. Called an hvac and got an estimate. The end all, the price to rewire didn't make sense. Dumb thermostat works just fine. Ecobee3 not so much
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kellner

customer_reviews.title: An iOS app update broke the ability to control vacations, tech support doesn't care
customer_reviews.text: I used to love my ecobee, because I travel a lot and I could set vacation mode from the subway on the way to the airport, and turn it off before boarding my flight home so my apartment was warm and ready for me. No longer. An iOS update in the latter half of 2018 broke this functionality (other controls still work), so I can't do that any more. Tech support laconically suggested a few things and now just said it's a "known issue" and keep closing my ticket, without solving it. So, the ecobee turned into an expensive toy that only really lasted about a year and a half. Not eager to invest in this brand again now.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: The remote sensor makes this the perfect thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: My thermostat is in the living room but the bedroom is always hotter or colder. When I would sleep, i would have to adjust the thermostat to compensate for the temperature difference. Even still, i had trouble holding a good temperature in the bedroom. With the Ecobee3, I am able to program the thermostat to use the remote sensor temperature while in sleep mode. Then, it switches to the main unit temperature during the day. I have also tied this in with Amazon Echo, Smartthings, and IFTTT for complete home automation control.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is ok. The sensors are nice and it's fairly easy to program so its reading only specific rooms at different times. Some things were difficult or impossible to do through the app and you have to go through their website. What is the most disappointing is the continual lack of connectivity....the app frequently says it cannot connect therefore eliminating why we got it. It works with alexa mostly, but needs a very specific set of words and its not simple. And doesnt always work. Still better than our last thermostat but had nest come out with sensors prior to us purchasing, we would have gone w that
customer_reviews.author: Rudi

customer_reviews.title: Solved Our Thermostat Placement Problems
customer_reviews.text: We love this thermostat. We installed two, with a total of four remote sensors. Very easy to install (even with having to deal with the lack of a common or c wire on one). They have completely solved our long-standing problems with poorly placed thermostats in our sprawling 1970s rambler. The iOS app is very intuitive and easy to use. We appreciate the HomeKit integration. We highly recommend the Ecobee 3 thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: KJF

customer_reviews.title: So far mixed results due to intermittent communications loss with Master Bedroom sensor.
customer_reviews.text: Thermostat installation not a problem. Thermostat installed on wall directly facing stairway leading to 2nd story bedrooms. First bedroom at top of stairs to immediate right is the Master. Turn left down a short hallway is our guestroom. Temperature sensor installed in both bedrooms. Master sensor is easily closest to the Thermostat. Thermostat setup to average temperatures between downstairs thermostat and Master temperature sensor. Receiving intermittent lost communications alerts between the Thermostat and Master Bedroom sensor but not the guest room sensor which is further away. Swapped remote sensors but problem persists. May request a replacement Thermostat since swapping sensors failed to resolve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Louis J. Yoo

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price - very user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! We've had programmable thermostats in the past but I (Jenni) found them very perplexing. I never could tell which buttons to hit to change the settings temporarily or for good. This one is far more user-friendly. It's a lot like an Apple product in that it is all menu driven and very intuitive. MY one tiny complaint is that it is rarely ever correct on the outside conditions. I am not sure why, but it will often tell us it is snowing when it is quite sunny and dry or vice-versa. No matter, really. We have windows for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Keiter

customer_reviews.title: Geeky, but the remote sensors are great
customer_reviews.text: Both my kids are millennial geeks but neither has bothered to figure out the Ecobee interface farther than to do simple overrides. One went out and bought Nest, maybe for the lower price. Myself, I love it. The Internet connection is pretty solid. Out of the 4 (yes, 4) Ecobee thermostats I own, I’ve lost the Internet link maybe 4 times over 4 years. The thermostat keeps working, and just needs the LAN reset. One is at a lake cabin - we keep it cold, and change the schedule to heat up if we’ll be up there (vice versa in summer). I keep at least one sensor in the coldest part of the house to monitor possible freezing.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Better than Nest
customer_reviews.text: Best thermostat I've ever purchased. I prefer it to the Nest. Works with the iPhone Home app as well. The remote sensors are a great addition especially in homes with only one cooling unit with multiple floors or where the wall mounted unit is in a different room then you spend most of your time. No need to swap from AC to Heat either, it'll do that itself as long as you tell it too. Took me about 15 minutes to install and have up and running.
customer_reviews.author: Joe in GA

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermostat, better than the 4!
customer_reviews.text: great Thermostat. Get this one over the Ecobee 4 if you already have an echo or echo dot. You can't change the name of alexa on this device so in our house if you are downstairs (we have a echo in the kitchen) and you say "hey alexa" this unit (in our upstaris) answers as well so you get 2 devices answering at same time. This doesn't have alexa built in so go with this one if you have a echo device.
customer_reviews.author: rick901

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased...
customer_reviews.text: Have an air handler system with humidistat. Opened the control panel on the air handler and found a rats nest of wiring with pigtails. After staring for sometime at the pigtails and the wiring guide/information for four wire systems, I finally figured out how to connect the Power Extender Kit. Worked like a charm and the thermostat works great. I also paired it with a Smart Things home automation hub which was also a snap - very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosECarlos

customer_reviews.title: Does not work properly.
customer_reviews.text: While this is a very easy to use thermostat, it nonetheless did not work correctly on my heat pump system. It drove the system crazy. Not sure if it was a faulty/defective unit or not but I returned it. I spent hours on the phone with Ecobee who assured me it was working fine. I spent over $300 on two independent HVAC services that both told me it was the thermostat causing the problems. They were right. Replaced it with a Honeywell 9000 and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Joel F Lupo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a townhome
customer_reviews.text: My thermostat finally died on me and after thorough research I found the econee3 to be a much improved replacement. The set up took maybe an hour and after some tests and adjustments it functioned perfectly. Living in a townhome with 2 bedrooms upstairs and the thermostat downstairs, the heat or AC never seemed comfortable at night. That is where the ecobee really excels. It allows me to tell it that I want my bedroom to be comfortable and ignore whatever temperature the actual thermostat reads. One would have to consider if their house really needs two (or more) sensors depending on the layout of the ductwork and house before purchasing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Jape

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate to buy one! Super easy installation!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This is the easiest device I've added to my smart home, even with having to add the wire adapter inside my furnace, since I have no "c" wire. This was way easier than the smart fans, light bulbs, switches, door sensors, or smart locks that I've already installed. Everything went seamlessly. And the remote sensors basically install themselves. You just need to pick a name and place to set them. And FYI, unlike most of the other popular smart thermostats, you can still manually control the fan through the thermostat without the "c" wire setup.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Koolaid

customer_reviews.title: Mind of its own
customer_reviews.text: First six months it worked great. Second six months started having a couple glitches. Now it gets set to turn on heater at 5:30 it turns on anywhere from 4:00 -6:00, setting is 70 degrees, I notice it’s very warm & its 75 in the house & heater is still running. Same thing happened in the summer with the AC set it for 78 & noticed it was pretty cool in the house & it was 74. Now when you live in CA & it’s 107 outside that extra cooling makes a huge difference on your bill. Keep telling husband to replace it back to old thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Sophie

customer_reviews.title: Fun home DIY project
customer_reviews.text: The instruction provides enough details for us to install the smart thermostat without calling HVAC service. The remote sensor is very helpful since our home office is always at least 5 degrees warmer than the downstairs’ rooms (where the thermostat was installed). It helps increase our productivity when working at home! Before the installation, we always felt too warm to stay focus and we needed to adjust the temperature settings repeatedly. Now, everything is under controlled.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy JST

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee outshines its competitors with functionality and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: So glad I did my research before making a purchase. I was initially interested in buying a Nest, but reviewed Consumer Reports and saw that the Nest was rated relatively low while the Ecobee3 was one of its top WiFi thermostats. I hadn't heard of Ecobee, so looked into their product options and user interface. I love that the Ecobee3 has a touch screen as well as the ability to make adjustments with the app or online. My only suggestion to Ecobee is to add more devices to their line-up, such as CO2 monitor & smoke/fire alarms that integrate with the thermostat. Great money to be made there AND provide added safety to its "hive."
customer_reviews.author: Joe Baker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent thermostat for multi level home
customer_reviews.text: We have a 3 level home with the thermostat next to the garage door on the second floor. I could never get the walkout basement, living room, and upstairs bedrooms in sync...until ecobee. We picked up 3 additional satellites and now the entire houses temperature is managed through averages. Install was easy and the unit looks sleek on the wall. Only word of advise is check the firmware because it "pushes" from the ecobee server, you can't "pull" an update like a computer/cellphone. If the unit doesn't update then email ecobee support. They were very responsive and pushed an update in 24hrs. Current version is 3.7.0.950. Enjoy even temperatures!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Pitcher

customer_reviews.title: Best Thermostat for Multi-Level Homes!
customer_reviews.text: This thermostat is a total winner! Installation was a snap (took me 30 minutes) and the performance has been as advertised. We own a 2-Story home with a finished basement but, in with infinite wisdom and an eye on cost-cutting, the builder only installed a single thermostat on the main floor. The resulting hot and cold spots have been more than annoying. The ecobee3 solved that problem with its' brilliant remote room sensors. Now, we have balanced temperatures throughout the home. I have already recommended it to several friends.
customer_reviews.author: S. Caton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.  Snap to install.  Remote sensors are key.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool technology. There are many smart thermostats out there and they all do basically the same thing. Ecobee differentiates their product by having remote sensor(s) capability. The sensor knows when you are in a room and therefore tells the thermostat to kick on the AC to reach the desired temp of the occupied room. After you vacate the room, a short period of time later the sensor will report back that the room is unoccupied and the thermostat will adjust accordingly. This is especially helpful for those warmer rooms that the thermostat does not sense.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Grady

customer_reviews.title: Love this "thermostat and much more"
customer_reviews.text: We have the Ecobee 3 with one remote sensor; sued to have problem with the previous thermostat since in the living room with one open fire. Every time we used the fire the radiation heat affected the thermostat and thus the house was cold. With the Ecobee and the remote sensor in the upper northward bedroom and balancing the downstairs radiators we have a constant house temperature all the time. We love this "thing"!
customer_reviews.author: Klintehamn

customer_reviews.title: I used an unused wire like the instructions said
customer_reviews.text: From the moment you open the box and look at the installation guide and the wiring diagram, stickers, juse everything is laid out so completely it made it a breeze to install. The installation guide on the app made it even easier. My set up did not have a power wire. I used an unused wire like the instructions said, intermittent power. Repeated the wire on both ends. No good. Called ecobee tech support and they said it could be that the wire is faulty, to use the optional power adapter. Connected it, works perfectly. The interface on the thermostat and the app are easy to use. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Addam

customer_reviews.title: I love this device
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. When paired with multiple remote sensors it is the best thermostat I've owned. I owned a Nest thermostat that was nice but it always thought that we weren't at home and so it got hot at night or anytime someone didn't walk through the hallway for a long time. I replaced my Nest with this ecobee and don't regret it! As I stated earlier, if you use the remote sensors and turn on the follow me feature it will only use the temperature of the rooms that are occupied to determine the temperature. Oh, and its smart enough to know that at night your sleeping. One of the best buys I've made.
customer_reviews.author: dred

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I'll probably buy a second one eventually. Replaced an old non-programmable Honeywell thermostat upstairs. The individual thermostat receiver was very useful. We want the temperature based on a single room upstairs that normally has its doors closed to keep pets out so the space is separate from where the thermostat itself is mounted. The wireless receiver worked great to solve that problem.
customer_reviews.author: M. Head

customer_reviews.title: dead after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: My ecobee 3 stopped working after 3 months, came home to a 58 degree house in the middle of a deep freeze in New England. Originally had to attach the c-wire conversion kit and it worked fine for 3 months, not sure if this is the problem, weather the conversion kit failed or not. Uninstalled ecobee and reinstalled my old thermostat that works fine. I have no confidence in this product. I have heard the customer service is a royal pain, so almost want to junk it, $200 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Lewis

customer_reviews.title: No internal battery, great external sensors.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this product four stars if not for a difficult installation. The thermostat requires a connection to household power (common). If no common connection is available a special adapter is provided, but must be installed at the location of the furnace which, for my house, is hard to access. It seems that the Nest thermostat contains a battery and is able to power itself from the charge in the other wires. I wish this product had the same feature or provided an option for acquiring a battery. The external temperature sensors are this product's most distinguishing feature, otherwise I don't think I would buy it again considering the painful install process.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, great CS, can't say enough good about it
customer_reviews.text: Love the ability to set comfort ranges for Home and Away. No longer any need to manually switch between furnace and air conditioner; ecobee does it automatically, which is great in our erratic weather. It's very good at recognizing when we're home or not. Love that I can check on it when gone. Echo integration is easy, but needs enhancement.. I called Customer Service, but found my answer online while waiting and hung up when I was #4 in line. That night CS called me to make sure I didn't still have any issue! That's CS. Can't wait to see what my 1st month utility savings will be.
customer_reviews.author: Opinionated

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: The Ecobee3 does well at what I expected it to. I bought it with 2 extra sensors and so when I sleep, it knows I'm in the bedroom and regulates the temperature of the apartment based on my bedroom temps. This is awesome to me. It was a bit more difficult for me to install because I didn't have a connected blue (C) wire. After that was resoved, things went smoothly. Nice to set and forget. The app allows me to monitor temps at home from work or where ever. Customer service is great and, being Canadians, they are quite polite. Highly recommend this for automatic and web controlled temps.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Get Much Better Than This
customer_reviews.text: We had a digital thermostat prior to getting the ecobee3, but I absolutely love the configurability and ease-of-use of this thermostat. It is so simple that everyone in my house is able to use it like they normally would, but I (as a geek) can take the extra step and integrate it into some of our home automation stuff thanks to compatibility with the Amazon Echo/Alexa and iOS Homekit compatibility. I love being able to control the thermostat no matter where I'm at (home or away) on my phone, and in general the thermostat just offers a very polished user interface.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Get the Ecobee 3!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Ecobee running with my Echo and Dot for about a month. They run very well together, and it is easy to set up. I love having my house on a schedule that is easy to update on the fly and override home and away temps with the ease of voice control or from my smartphone. Ecobee 3 is the best choice in smart thermostats because it also comes with a power kit to work with most HVAC systems.
customer_reviews.author: Big A

customer_reviews.title: Poor Decision
customer_reviews.text: My thermostat worked for a short period of time during the spring and was off during the summer. When I turned it on this fall, the furnace would not turn off once it reached temperature. I ended up putting my old programmable thermostat back in. I reached out to Ecobee for help and they seemed to be ignoring my problem so far. The thermostat is less than a year old and I would have thought that they would warranty it. I can't say that it was worth the expense.
customer_reviews.author: Steve In CT

customer_reviews.title: BEST HOME IMPROVEMENT EVER
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Install was so simple, I think it took about 30 minutes from box to wall and it was all setup. I even connected it to my Homekit and wifi. It's winter, so right now I'm using the lil'bee in my living room at one end of the house because the thermostat is at the other end. It's only about 1 degree difference, but I think in the summer I'll move the lil'bee upstairs to help cool down the house. Home IQ is pretty awesome because you can see how your home changes temp over time and how weather changes effect your internal temperature. EVERY ONE SHOULD GET ONE.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee abandons products
customer_reviews.text: They’re on to working on their next product, a camera, which is totally not what existing customers are asking for. So their existing foundational product, the thermostat, continues to get ignored. It’s still missing basic features like programmable fan-only option and cool stuff like open formats on their sensors. Management is on to their next shiny thing, and loyal customers suffer.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Horrible Customer Service. Right from the box the sensor is not working properly, keep loosing connection to the thermostat at 10 feet away at direct sight. Contacted ecobee support and they told me to go and buy a pack of sensor in Home depot to troubleshoot and then return it to them so I get my money back. So, how a company provide "support" screwing up and wasting other companies time like in this case Home Depot. I still can't believe it. Im about to return this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: The product warranty is worthless from a practical stand point ...
customer_reviews.text: The product warranty is worthless from a practical stand point. I just spent $479 to have a HVAC company figure out why my furnace wasn't running. The answer the thermostat was not working. After spending an hour and fifteen minutes waiting for a tech and his wanted me to do more testing, Ecobee said they would send out a new part and I would receive it in two or three days. It's winter in Illinois! Wait two or three days for parts to get heat! Not very practical so I had to buy a whole new thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: The install was easy enough. Took less than 30 minutes. Instructions and videos were clear. The only complaint I have with the install process is the double sided sticky tape for the PEK was not strong enough to hold it. So I had to use standard tape to hold in my HVAC. The Thermostat portion was easy to mount too. It looks great on the wall compared to my old unit. Setup was straightforward. Calibration was taking longer than the 20 minutes, but as soon as I pressed on the display it cleared and started working. I really enjoy using the app and HomeKit integration is very nice to have. It fits very well in my smart enabled home.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: ... for a little over a month and am really glad I purchased it
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product for a little over a month and am really glad I purchased it. I like how you can have sensors in different locations to help average your temp in your home throughout the whole home based on where you place the extra sensors. We have a two story place and the challenge we were running into before was trying to keep the temp the same upstairs when the thermostat is down stairs. This is no longer a problem with this thermostat. There is still a lot I am learning with other things you can tweak and adjust to help save money on heating your home etc.
customer_reviews.author: Karla and David

customer_reviews.title: If you don't need heat...
customer_reviews.text: To long to post everything we went through. If you don't need heat its for you. Hours on the phone and rewiring and reconfiguring over and over.. It's going back. Should not be this hard to get it working... My old thermostat is working fine I'm not freezing anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J. Lyman

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thermostat! I added two extra sensors so I have three (four if you count the thermostat itself). It's been great to see just how much colder the downstairs bedrooms are vs the upstairs. We closed some registers and were able to see the effect this had on the temperature everywhere and now it's evened out quite well. It is incredibly nice to be able to remotely see what the temperature is in each room while we are away, and to be alerted should the temperature drop below a set level if power should go out, etc. For a thermostat, it's pretty neat!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product, excellent documentation and customer support.
customer_reviews.text: Works even better than I expected.I'd give it 5.5 stars if I could! the installation video that's part of the ecobee is a joy to use - It exactly matches the hardware (hello Insteon)) and is easy to follow. I installed two of them with absolutely no problem. After setup I turned the systems back on and control worked flawlessly. The user interface for setting up scheduling intuitive and just works. I had a couple of minor questions; Customer support responded to my emails within a day with clear, accurate instructions to resolve my issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gortzh

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper and better alternatives out there
customer_reviews.text: Decent product but for the money the features are not worth the price tag. Owned this device for a couple years now. It is nice that it works with Alexa however still does not talk to Google so you need to pick your home automation carefully. For the money I advise a smart honeywell thermostat. A third of the price of the ecobee with most of the features (including working with Alexa). The weather app included on the thermostat itself also doesn't sync to my local time. Contacted Ecobee support and never resolved the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ravan71

customer_reviews.title: Skeptic changed mind
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product and I was a skeptic. I had a programable T stat for a while and really did not know what I would need a smart T stat for. I changed my mind and tried this one. It is amazingly smart and tracks a ton of data. From inside temp and humidity , outside weather factors on the temperature and occupancy of areas and temperature change. Needless to say you can do much more programing and control from anywhere with the app on phone. Simple and very elegant!
customer_reviews.author: Toby

customer_reviews.title: Never turned on
customer_reviews.text: When this item arrived it looked to be in "rough shape". There were black marks all over the device and its components. We tried twice to install, since it did not come with instructions we relied on the internet. Both attempts were unsuccessful and since our original thermostat is working we have concluded the device is defective. By this we mean that it never turned on and the screen remained black. This leads me to wonder why it may have been returned in the first place, since this item was obviously used and if it was tested prior to resale. We wasted many hours trying to install this and are very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: lpetersen4

customer_reviews.title: Skip the ecobee4, buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the best thing I've added to my Smart Home...can be used with my Echo easily. Install took a few hours (because it was raining, the actual process took maybe 30 min, even with installing the PEK Adapter), Support is more than helpful. Saving me money already a few months in. I was looking at the ecobee4, though came to find out that the only difference is that it has Alexa built in...I have Echos everywhere in the house so this was unneeded. Also, it doesn't feature everything that Alexa can do so the price difference doesn't justify not just getting an ecobee3 and an Echo Dot.
customer_reviews.author: Gentleman Adventurer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I've had the ecobee for about 4 months and while I haven't seen any real reduced energy costs, it did take a few weeks to get the settings right. Now that I feel I have everything set correctly for my home, I truly expect to see savings in the near future. I especially love that it has external sensors. I have a large multi story house with only one central unit. It's always been difficult to have a comfortable temperature on all 3 levels. This has helped immensely already and as it learns our habits it should only get better
customer_reviews.author: Casey T.

customer_reviews.title: homekit support is fantastic if you are in the Apple ecosystem
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Nest to ecobee3, and wish I had much sooner! Our nursery is on the 2nd floor, whereas our thermostat is on the 1st floor. My wife and I were always struggling to maintain an ideal temperature in the nursery, and now with the ecobee3 and its remote sensor, this is effortless. Also, homekit support is fantastic if you are in the Apple ecosystem, especially with IOS10. My only minor complaint is that the remote sensor doesn't measure humidity.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, functions below average
customer_reviews.text: The temperature is no where near as accurate as other thermostats. I have placed the sensors right next to the Ecobee thermostat and they are always different from 3-5 degrees. After contacting support multiple times, they just told me to override the temperature to manually set it. That obviously doesn't change the discrepancy since the sensors are still 3-5 degrees different from the main thermostat. Considering this is supposed to be a high end product, it doesn't fit that at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mattsuth

customer_reviews.title: no longer connects to app
customer_reviews.text: Awful UI. Slow response. The other day it broke because of their website connectivity (why are they routing everything centrally) and was running the AC nonstop... absurd. Took 2 years for them to fix the weather function. Had some back and forth with them via email which was useless. Now it no longer connects to my phone app because of versioning.
customer_reviews.author: nishi

customer_reviews.title: Bad Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how this works because I can't get it installed. The install video / app says to call if your existing thermostat only has 2 wires. I have oil furnace w/ water baseboard heaters. My thermostat has a white and red wire only. I called and stayed on hold for 1 hr 25 min with no movement. I eventually left my name and phone number for a call back. It is now 3 days later and I still haven't received a call. I'm going to try one more time this weekend and then return it if their service isn't available. Check your wires before you order this. If you only have 2 wires, buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: rcmoore

customer_reviews.title: The Only Smart Thermostat You Need To Consider
customer_reviews.text: I did my research before buying a "smart" thermostat and Ecobee beat out all the others for features and reviews. I have been satisfied ever since. I was able to install it and program it myself and I love the easy access to it through my smartphone. The sensors are small and discrete and can be placed anywhere in a room. They can also be moved to other locations int he same room or other rooms if necessary. Ecobee also detected an issue with one of the sensors and replaced it at no charge to me. I HIGHLY recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan M. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Sleek upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Working correctly. So far, so good. Did a lot of research before purchase. We had an old Honeywell thermostat that operated with battery power. Used the compatibility checker on the Ecobee site to ensure we could use the device. Lucked out and turned out we DID have a C wire tucked behind the old thermostat, which made the process a lot more simple. Took us about 30-40 minutes to install ourselves. Definitely recommend the Ecobee3 app. It included full instructions and videos for proper installation. So sleek and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: LovelyH

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, installed it myself and it still worked. Had questions about the furnace wiring and the C wire issue so I called a tech form Ecobee. He was very helpful and walked me through the process so it was easy. Sensor is cool and works great. Really like changing thermostat settings from my phone. It has only been a couple days but I am very pleased with the entire process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Silent thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 7 day programmable t-stat with this one and really like it's features. The contacts are inaudible which is great since it is right outside the bedroom. Still trying to get used to having the weather forecast available but it is a nice feature. Being able to connect to WiFi and control the temps from anywhere is very convenient. The remote sensor is extremely useful for bonus rooms or tucked away bedrooms in the house. I now have 2 of these thermostats because of the features. One thing I would like to see an update on is more comfortable settings. There are only 3 currently that I know of. Adding more to have the flexibility would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: TiredDad

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and Interface.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with Ecobee3 WiFi thermostat. I had to return the original purchased on Amazon since I had 4 or 5 vertical and horizontal lines on the screen that wouldn't go away. I contacted Ecobee support and they had no way to clear these lines and I would have to return the thermostat. I returned it to Amazon and purchased it from a local retailer. The new thermostat works great. The installation is very easy and probably had everything running within an hour. I've been using the iPhone app, Ecobee web site from PC and also utilizing the IFTTT recipes for additional functionality. I like the bright display on the screen and the iPhone app has been easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. Bodine

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Thermostat on the market
customer_reviews.text: Let me say I have a Nest, a Sensi, and now an Ecobee - all in different locations. The Ecobee is by far the best. Easiest to install. Like the Nest, it comes with 2 sizes of mounting plates (extra on the Sensi). It offers the most flexibility and customization on functions as well. Best part are the sensors. They are easiest setup ever, and if you are like me, and the thermostat is not close to the main area that is lived in, it works great at regulating temps. I have multiple HVAC units in my home, and by using the sensors, it evens out the temperatures amount the units, and the rooms. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Thermostat. A cheaper, comparable Nest alternative
customer_reviews.text: The Ecobee3 was a breeze to install (I luckily had a C wire so it was the easiest it could be). The setup was also very simple once I powered the unit on. I've been happy with the mobile app that it comes with and love the ability to control the thermostat remotely. The unit is fully-featured and has many options for setting up home and away times. There is also good integration with Apple's HomeKit (which I use) and with IFFTT to send reminders and such. Overall this is a great smart thermostat. I've been telling people to look into it rather than the Nest due to price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W. Camara

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, I have an older system
customer_reviews.text: Great Product, I have an older system, the HVAC is from 1987 so I had our HVAC guy install it and worked fine with the included adpater. It has worked great do so far we even set it up to turn on Cool or heat automatically dpeneding on temp. I love the fact it has a UWP Windows app so I have the Ecobee app on my Xbox, Surface tablet and even Windows Mobile Phone. The Sensors modules work great I'm going to buy more to get better averages for Temp's around the house. This product seems to be better thought out with more features and more app/connectivity options then other Wifi thermostats.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: The temperature reading is not consistent with the actual temperature ...
customer_reviews.text: The temperature reading is not consistent with the actual temperature in the room. I have a portable temperature sensor and so I thought that I had calibrated the ecobee3 with it and after a few hours, there was a difference of about 6 degrees and the room was supercold in which the portable unit was measuring several degrees cooler than the ecobee3. At times the ecobee3 readings jumps higher to 10 degrees more than the actual temperature. I found my mother and caregiver freezing one day and found the ecobee3 temperature to be off by several degrees.
customer_reviews.author: MarrCarr

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended smart thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended smart thermostat. I installed a couple of these for my son, and decided to get one myself. Very good instructions. I had to use the Power Extender Kit on one installation; the others had C wires so they were a piece of cake. I had one small issue with the fan setting on my unit, and I emailed tech support. They responded very quickly (on a Sunday on a holiday weekend no less).
customer_reviews.author: Flyfisher

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but the sensor needs to come with adhesive
customer_reviews.text: I love the Ecobee3, had a little bit of a problem installing but that was on my end. When I called Ecobee customer service I spoke with a representative that I literally couldn't understand, so it made the issue that much more frustrating. I do love that I can customize the settings and update everything from my phone. It's absolutely worth the money. My only issue is with the sensor, it did not come with any type of adhesive attached or included to put the sensor on its stand.
customer_reviews.author: Bmo

customer_reviews.title: Customer Support is the worst I have ever experienced
customer_reviews.text: I have 4xEcobee brand new Thermostasts (3 x Ecobee 3 and 1 x Ecobee4) and up until today was planning to have 5 ... Instead I had technical support hang up on and refuse to provide an additional part. On top of that every time I called in the same person would hang up on me and not escalate to the manager. @Ecobee I hope your team is reading this ...
customer_reviews.author: MSQinTX

customer_reviews.title: Love love my Ecobees
customer_reviews.text: We have a double system in our home-I thought I could get by with one, but nope! It drove me nuts. It is really nice to be in another state and being able to control the air/heat by phone. Also, when the kids turn it up or down and we are freezing/dying of heat stroke, all I have to do it adjust on my phone.....man this sounds lazy, lol. But this is really nice and pretty reliable. Nice when it tells me the humidity is too high or low, and the daily weather.
customer_reviews.author: BW Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: I like the ability to monitor the thermostat activity over time ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had it a few weeks now. I like the ability to monitor the thermostat activity over time and how it compares to outside temperature. The second sensor is also very useful because our bedrooms are upstairs and we like it to be cooler at night. Placing the second sensor upstairs and setting my ecobee to use it for regulating temperature allows us to do this effectively. Before I had to guess what downstairs temperature needed to be set to have the right temperature upstairs. The Away feature is very nice, it reduces the usage while no one is home.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Childers

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Very easy to install. The thermostat knows where you hooked the wires. Then it walks you through every step of the setup. Even walks you through hooking it up to your wifi. You can download the app on your phone and control the thermostat from anywhere. We bought the extra remote sensors. It is awesome because now we know the temperature in different rooms in the house. It also keeps track of what rooms are occupied. I have checked it while we were away and the sensors say unoccupied. I thought that was great because if someone was in your house you would know. So far I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L. Frizzle

customer_reviews.title: The best thermostat on the market at this time
customer_reviews.text: Such a great thermostat and has a nice app to go with it. If you have an apple watch then you can control the temperature with your watch as well. Connected to a homekit this thermostat adds additional features such as geofencing. For a while, my firmware would not update on the thermostat but after one call to ecobee this got cleared up. Customer service is top notch. The additional sensor adds a nice touch over its competitors. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Devtonereno

customer_reviews.title: The mobile app is great for making adjustments on the go
customer_reviews.text: The remote sensors are one of the main selling points of this product. I have sensors situated all throughout my house and it helps balance out the temperatures between the upstairs and downstairs. There is also a "follow me" function on the thermostat that will only take into account temperature readings in areas of the house that are currently occupied. Another cool feature of this thermostat is the ability to set home, away, and sleep conditions. I can have the house set to a comfortable temperature while I'm home, but if the thermostat senses that I am away for a while it will allow the house to fluctuate in temperature a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Technical Support/Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of reviews about the product and features, so I won't go into this. Instead, let me praise the ecobee folks on their technical support and customer service - they are absolutely fantastic!!! I installed 2 ecobee units in our new home. Unfortunately for me, the previous owners had installed 2 Honeywell "smart" thermostats (circa 2003ish) that had a proprietary power extender kits, which made the wiring difficult to decipher. Frank at ecobee support spent a great deal of time with me to figure out how to get the ecobee's working. He was very nice, knowledgeable, and very encouraging. I had a great experience! Thank you ecobee guys!!
customer_reviews.author: John Paul B. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Ecobee3 for one main reason, my wife could not figure out how to adjust our current digital thermostat. Now she simply opens the app on her phone and it's done. She thinks it's attractive and easy to understand. She loves it. I chose it over the Nest because of the remote sensors. We have a video room at the end of our home that's always either too hot or too cold. I placed a sensor at the entrance of that room and now the temperature at either end of the house is much closer. I've had the Ecobee3 about three weeks and so far I give it thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Force push temperature control
customer_reviews.text: The device works fine, but Ecobee forced all owners to join eco+, AND there is no way to opt-out. The reason I didn’t get the discount from ConED was because I didn’t want them to be able to control my temperature, but now Ecobee forced us to give them the control for FREE! Bad company. Bad practice!
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Ecobee is the best choice
customer_reviews.text: If you have a problem with getting temps. in your favorite room just right due to the thermostat being in a colder or hotter room, then you need to buy the remote sensor for your favorite room. I did and it solved a problem I've had for years. Now my heat or cooling runs based on my remote temp. instead of the unit temp. where the thermos. is located. Install was easy. I used the big backplate to cover the hole from my Honeywell thermostat. I can use my Amazon Eco to bump or drop my temp. early. I highly recommend this unit due to having a remote sensor. I didn't see that option for the others.
customer_reviews.author: Archie H. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, looks nice, execution (mainly software) could be a bit better. E.g hold can be set only for 2 or 4 hours - why not till the time I specify (like it was the case with my old, much simpler thermostat)? The software (on ipad and web) looks really snazzy, but when you try to use it it is a bit clunky. Some of the graphs are really awkward to scroll. Doesn't seem to show historical temperatures measured by main unit and the remote sensor separately. Nonetheless it's a huge convenience to be able to manipulate everything from the phone app, and other than the above quirks it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Zyoot

customer_reviews.title: Just bought my second one
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my second one of these. I have two HVAC two stage units and needed the remote sensor for one side of the house. I liked the non-motion away feature for energy savings during the day so I bought the second. The remote sensor is the simplest available on the market. As for programming and remote access, it is straightforward. The GeoFencing is a little cumbersome as it requires a third party APP rather than its own APP. Other than that, I have very happy. I installed both myself.
customer_reviews.author: letti001

customer_reviews.title: Great for Elderly Parent
customer_reviews.text: Terrific for helping elderly parent stay comfortable in their own home. My mother was getting confused on how to operate a standard thermostat, turning it on and off rather than adjusting temperature. This thermostat prevents her from doing that. It also allows her to simply call me for a temperature adjustment which I can do from my phone wherever I am. I chose this one over the Nest because of the separate sensors available for other rooms. Although her home is small, a sensor in her bedroom is beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Product / Even better service!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Ecobee3 mainly because of the remote sensor. I can not tell you how happy I am! First, my setup was odd in that I didn't have a "C" wire and my heat and ac are separate so installing was a bit more difficult. I called Ecobee Support and HOLY COW, not only did the walk me through it but after taking pictures of (1) the old thermostat wiring (2) the AC wiring and (3) the heat wiring (which is 20 years old), they sent me directions on EXACTLY what I needed to do within hours of calling & sending photos. Would DEFINITELY buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher V.

customer_reviews.title: Innovative Setup Process, and Outstanding Value!
customer_reviews.text: The ecobee is a fantastic addition to our home. The secondary sensor, especially, gives us much greater insight and control of our house's HVAC system. It was really easy to install, even though I had to use the included power adapter to send a power wire up to the thermostat from the furnace. The instructions given through the app are incredibly helpful, and you can take pictures of the setup as you go for reference later. I wish more companies would do setup instructions that way!
customer_reviews.author: Tortuga

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Thermostat!
customer_reviews.text: Love the Ecobee3 with the app for my iPhone. The widget shows the main temp and the remote sensor. Very easy to program. You can do it by the unit, smart phone or computer. I was looking between this and the Nest. I am very happy I went with the Ecobee3. I plan to add a few more sensors down the road. I also was able to apply for the $100 rebate check from ComEd, which came very fast!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Chojnowski

customer_reviews.title: I went back and forth on which smart thermostat to buy and am very pleased I settled ...
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth on which smart thermostat to buy and am very pleased I settled on the Ecobee3. With local utility rebates factored in, it will easily pay for itself. I love the ability to control the thermostat with the App or Alexa. The best part though is the room sensors, there have been many days where we spent more time away than we intended and when we came back, the Ecobee had noticed we were gone and was not cooling the house as much. We have already noticed the savings with only a month or so of using it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate temperature reading
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and one is consistently displaying the wrong temperature (validated with multiple thermometers including the remote sensor). Ecobee customer service was not very helpful, telling me to adjust the temperature using the threshold option. That's fine, but for the cost of theses thermostats, the minimum they should do is display the correct room temp. The variety of options and settings are also not intuitive. Would look for another option.
customer_reviews.author: Pete G

customer_reviews.title: Love this thermostat
customer_reviews.text: Bought an Ecobee3 after reading reviews and comparing it to other thermostats out there like the Nest. Glad I made the purchase. It was easy to setup. Comes with an installation option in case yo don't have a C wire for your system. I had it up and running in a short time. I have a Windows Phone and while they don't have an official app there is a third party one that provides full functionality.
customer_reviews.author: J. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Seamless integration and saves money in the long run
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with the Ecobee 3! The price, installation, packaging, and functionality are all 5 stars! I installed the thermostat in under an hour and had it running shortly after. The app, thermostat, and sensor demonstrate seamless integration. For a thermostat compared to non-smart ones it comes off as expensive but the savings in electricity or gas will prove to be significant. Vs the competition the Ecobee is similar but also home kit compatible with Apple products plus a better user interface. Five star recommendation with no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the negative reviews are all about. Most likely user error. I had zero trouble installing and setting up this device. Just check if you have the infamous "c-wire" before you purchase. Duh! All apps are setup with my phone and iPad as well as Alexa. I like the look too, nice and modern. This was a really nice upgrade from the old Honeywell thermostat we used to have. 2 thumbs up from me. I'll be sure to update this review if any future issues should surface, but I don't think they will.
customer_reviews.author: VikingChin

customer_reviews.title: Installation was fairly easy although I had to have my A/C guy connect ...
customer_reviews.text: Installation was fairly easy although I had to have my A/C guy connect the wiring (mine did not match any of the examples). I really like multiple sensors that can be put in different rooms. I also like using it with Alexa. I wish you could track the number of hours the unit has run within a given time frame - other similar products do this. Also, the alerts and reminders could be more robust. I'm hoping a software updgrade is in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin in Houston

customer_reviews.title: Best Thermostat available
customer_reviews.text: This is the best smart thermostat out there. The remote sensors are amazing. With most thermostats, it records the temperature near the return, which may not be the best place in your house. The Ecobee has remote sensors that record the temperature where you are, not in the hallway. It uses this data to set a whole house temp, not just at the return. After running one for 6 months, I purchased a 2nd Ecobee for my second floor. Now it stays the set temp in my bedroom, not 5 degrees warmer. Wifi and Alexa enabled. On vacation, set it to away from your smartphone. Hands down, the best thermostat on the market today.
customer_reviews.author: Techy Camper Diver

customer_reviews.title: This was amazingly easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was amazingly easy to install. One little glitch and the support center walked me right through it. I absolutely love this thermostat Update: used for AC since summer when went to turn on heat, it didn't work. Talked to support and they ended up having me call an electrician, after lengthy repairs and new wired run to thermostat still no heat. Thermostat just will not work. Upset as too late to return so out of my money
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered, received and installed 12 hours later - VERY IMPRESSED AMAZON!!!!
customer_reviews.text: REALLY IMPRESSED!!!! I ordered this on Amazon at 8:35AM this morning and selected same day delivery. 12 hours later I have this thing installed and working perfectly!!! It was really easy to install after watching a quick video on Youtube. Hopefully it stands the test of time but so far I really like it. But completely impressed on the extremely quick turn around and shipping by Amazon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: FABES

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had purchased this thermostat a long time ago! Wonderful thermostat! We have an older furnace without the auxiliary power wire. I was worried because when I went to install the included power supply I found that the board in our furnace didn't have the required spot to tap into either. But one relatively quick call to a very knowledgeable and kind customer service rep and I had the power supply installed! Great customer service and a wonderful thermostat! My favorite option is controlling the thermostat from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: craigers

customer_reviews.title: really like it
customer_reviews.text: The first Ecobee the seller had to replace because it was not working right. They Sent The replacement without an issue ( it was prime) Husband had it up and running within 30 minutes. It took me longer to get it set up like I wanted. ****when I had to call Ecobee CS to set up the replacement because wasn't simple as they said, it took a long time to get a person. They were very helpful and polite but it was a long wait. ***
customer_reviews.author: lynndoll10

customer_reviews.title: Great product whose time has come.....
customer_reviews.text: Excellent support from Ecobee with any questions I posted. The remote thermostat option is the only thermostat I now use. The base thermostat location is not in an area where we are normally living (front foyer). Placed the Li'l bee on the kitchen table, and it is doing the job perfectly. Wife is no longer complaining about too cold or hot. Love the option where the Ecobee senses whether we are home or away based upon my cel phone location, and as I return home, it turns the heat up while I am about 2 blocks away.
customer_reviews.author: HJS

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several smart thermostats, I always revert back to my original, sure the power bill is going to be high, sure it will run constantly, but there is one thing that is accurate about my original vs the ecobee and that is the calibration. My ecobee reported interior house temperature as 68* and my actual was 76* with 100% humidity after rainfall. Now living in Alabama we pay good money to have our ac! I installed my original back on and the Ecobee is headed back to Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Dog

customer_reviews.title: Heat pump + ecobee = HUGE power bills
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy if you like to keep your money and have a heat pump. Since installing my electric bill has quadrupled. I've worked with the settings for 4 months and still nothing. Needs a setting that asks before running emergency heat. Going to take back all of mine and consider a Honeywell 8000. The various settings don't solve the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Not ready to be a commercial product.
customer_reviews.text: Installed 2 of these in my 2004 home. One was for a gas furnace and the other was for an electric/ heat pump hvac. Both units constantly gave me issues. The one to the electric furnace would glitch out and change modes all the time. The gas furnace one would turn off and would keep the air running. I had to turn off the unit every day from the breaker to get it to work. I wanted to like these but it ended up causing me to many issues.
customer_reviews.author: Reelguy

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a winner
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for 2 days now but, it is much nicer than the Honeywell smart WiFi thermostat it replaced. Installation was a breeze, I had it up and running in less than 20 minutes. I like the app it looks exactly like the actual thermostat. Time will tell if it actually saves money over my last thermostat, I have it set so if it detects no one home it will change to away automatically. It also will detect if I am home when I am scheduled to be away and adjust accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rowell

customer_reviews.title: the Ecobee3 is fantastic. Installation was fairly easy
customer_reviews.text: A few weeks in, the Ecobee3 is fantastic. Installation was fairly easy, the only issues I really had were with mounting - but that is specific to my house, and with the configuration - but it's not Ecobee's fault that its difficult to find information on how heat pump reversing valves work (switch on heat or cool). Once I had that figured out, everything is working great. The app works well, thermostat works great, and the web interface is really good also. No complaints. Looking forward to hitting the one month mark so I can see the full breadth of data available on the web interface.
customer_reviews.author: Jake A.

product_meta.title: ecobee3 Smarter Wi-Fi Thermostat with Remote Sensor, 2nd Generation
product_meta.description: Style:ecobee3Ordinary thermostats only read the temperature in one room, but are supposed to deliver comfort in all rooms. Ecobee3 remote sensors deliver the right temperature in the rooms that matter most. Now homekit enabled. Ecobee3 sensors know which rooms are occupied to deliver the right temperature in the right places. And they know whether someone's home to help you save energy and money when you're away. Ecobee3 comes with 1 free remote sensor that measures temperature and occupancy. You can have up to 32 sensors. The more you add, the smarter your Ecobee3 becomes at delivering comfort where it matters and savings where it counts.
feature_bullets: Works with Alexa for voice control (Alexa device sold separately).

Smart, really smart - intuitively understands when to turn on your heating or cooling equipment based on your home's unique energy profile, the weather outside, and thousands of other data points to make sure you're comfortable at all times
Knows you have a life - senses whether anyone's home and which rooms are occupied, delivering comfort when you're at home and saving you energy and money when you're not
